jaw, cheek

= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= collective designation of various cold blooded, aquatic vertebrates, having gills, usually fins, and typically an elongated body covered with scales; or, in a loosely sense, any of various other aquatic animals; ► an important source of food
= a body of water flowing to and from the Nile river, whether in the form of a manmade canal or a subsidiary river branch, especially those of the Nile delta region

= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are killed or severely wounded by enemies
= to bring together people, animals, plants, and/or other things from different places for a common purpose
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals to come together as a group for a common purpose
possibly shortened form of נֶפֶשׁ חַיָּה living creature: = animal; ◄ generic, sometimes referring to all animals, sometimes limited to wild land animals only

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for walking or as attribute of a ruler, shepherd, or prophet; gives support to the sick and elderly; ≈ associated with authority and support

= a tall grass with stiff, sharply pointed leaves and a plume like flower head that reaches to more than 2 m; it grows in lakes and streams, the roots creeping across the bottom of the lake to produce new leaves and stalks; or on riverbanks; ◄ Phragmites australis (Common reed) or Arundo donax (Giant reed); ► used for baskets, mats, flutes, pens, arrows, and roof coverings; ≈ symbol of weakness and undependability, but also flexibility
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

literally: palm of the hand, but used in a figurative sense with the focus on the activities that are performed with one's hands; = someone's actions, whether or not performed with one's hands, for which one is personally responsible

Node.gloss: to split|to cleave|to rip open|to cut|to rend|to maul|to divide|to break through
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities or human cause an object to split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence
= the joint between each arm and the main part of the human body; ► often used for carrying heavy weights

= the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= an organized military force equipped for fighting on land; this term denotes primarily the foot soldiers, though it can also be used to refer to the entire fighting force, including chariots and horsemen
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= town; ◄ on the Phoenician coast; ► famous as sea port

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= causative process by which the hair on one's scalp is made to disappear
= the joint between each arm and the main part of the human body; ► often used for carrying heavy weights
= a fixed regular payment for work, either with money or in kind; ≈ by extension: all that happens in return for one's actions

= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to cause to sprout|to make come up|to cause to bring forth
Node.definition: = causative process by which a deity or the earth causes plants or horns to come up and start growing; ≈ sometimes extended to denote the coming in existence of people, conditions, or activities

= outgrowth of bone encased in hardened skin, often curved and pointed, found in pairs on the heads of cattle, sheep, goats, and other animals; ≈ associated with strength and honor; a raised horn symbolizes confidence and/or pride
